title: FE: Implement Core Calculation Engine with Order of Operations
description: Integrate a math expression parser library (e.g., math.js) to handle evaluation of strings. Ensure the parser is configured to correctly follow PEMDAS/BODMAS rules for +, -, ×, ÷ operators.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: The expression '5+3*2' evaluates to 11. The expression '8/0' is caught and throws a specific 'DivisionByZeroError'. The parser handles decimal and negative numbers correctly.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >90% coverage; Integration tests passing; Documentation updated
deployment_notes: Core logic, must be thoroughly tested before merging.
business_value: Establishes the core, non-negotiable functionality of the calculator.

title: FE: Develop Calculator UI Components (Display & Keypad)
description: Create the main React components for the calculator's primary display (for input/result) and the keypad containing numbers (0-9) and basic operators (+, -, ×, ÷, =).
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: Components are rendered correctly based on the application's theme. Clicking a button updates the calculator's state. The UI is fully responsive on mobile and desktop viewports.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; UI matches design mockups; A11y checks passed
deployment_notes: Foundation UI, must be responsive.
business_value: Establishes the core, non-negotiable functionality of the calculator.

title: Infra: Define and Provision AWS Cognito User Pool via Terraform
description: Create the Terraform configuration for the AWS Cognito User Pool and App Client. Configure the password policy to require 12 characters, mixed case, number, and special character.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: `terraform apply` successfully creates the User Pool. The password policy in the AWS Console matches the requirements. The App Client is configured for a public SPA with no client secret.
definition_of_done: Terraform code peer reviewed and merged; Resources successfully provisioned in dev environment.
deployment_notes: Critical path for all authentication features.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which is foundational for user retention.

title: FE: Create Registration View Component
description: Develop the React component for the user registration form, including fields for email, password, and confirm password. Implement client-side validation for required fields, email format, and password match.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: The form renders with all required fields. Client-side validation errors appear for invalid email, mismatched passwords, and empty fields. The 'Register' button is disabled until the form is valid.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; UI matches design mockups; A11y checks passed.
deployment_notes: Can be developed in parallel with backend/infra work.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which is foundational for user retention.

title: FE: Implement Cognito Registration Logic
description: Integrate the AWS Cognito SDK (e.g., via AWS Amplify) to handle the user registration process. On form submission, call the Cognito API to create a new user.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: Submitting a valid form successfully creates a user in the Cognito User Pool. API errors from Cognito (e.g., 'email already exists') are caught and displayed to the user. On success, the user is automatically logged in and redirected.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing; E2E tests passing.
deployment_notes: Depends on both the UI and the backend infrastructure.
business_value: Enables user-specific data persistence, which is foundational for user retention.

title: BE: Implement JWT Authentication Strategy and Guard
description: Create a NestJS Passport strategy using `passport-jwt` to validate JWTs issued by AWS Cognito. Create a global `AuthGuard` to protect endpoints.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: The strategy correctly validates a valid JWT. The strategy rejects expired, invalid, or incorrectly signed tokens. A protected route returns 401 Unauthorized for invalid tokens and 200 OK for valid tokens.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed against security checklist; Integration tests passing with >90% coverage.
deployment_notes: Backend foundation for securing all user-specific APIs.
business_value: Serves as the gateway to all personalized and persisted features.

title: FE: Implement Login View and OAuth PKCE Flow
description: Develop the LoginView component and the client-side logic for the OAuth 2.0 Authorization Code flow with PKCE. This includes redirecting to the Cognito Hosted UI and exchanging the authorization code for JWTs.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: User is correctly redirected to the Cognito Hosted UI to log in. After successful login, the client receives an authorization code. The client successfully exchanges the code for tokens. Tokens are stored securely in memory.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E test passing; Security review of token handling complete.
deployment_notes: Core authentication mechanism for the frontend.
business_value: Serves as the gateway to all personalized and persisted features.

title: FE: Implement Angle Mode State and UI Controls
description: Create a Redux slice to manage the calculator's angle mode state (DEG, RAD, GRAD). Add a UI control to the calculator keypad that dispatches actions to change this state.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: A Redux slice for calculator settings is created with an `angleMode` property. The UI control correctly displays and updates the current mode. The default mode is 'DEG'.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; UI interaction verified.
deployment_notes: Adds a new control to the existing keypad.
business_value: Provides fundamental functionality required for a scientific calculator.

title: FE: Update Calculation Engine to Respect Angle Mode
description: Modify the core calculation engine to read the current angle mode from the state before evaluating trigonometric functions. Implement the necessary angle conversions.
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: sin(90) evaluates to 1 in 'DEG' mode. sin(pi/2) evaluates to 1 in 'RAD' mode. sin(100) evaluates to 1 in 'GRAD' mode.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >90% coverage for trig functions.
deployment_notes: Requires both the engine and the state to be in place.
business_value: Provides fundamental functionality required for a scientific calculator.

title: Test: E2E Test for Registration Flow
description: Create a Cypress E2E test that covers the user registration flow, including the happy path and key failure scenarios (email exists, weak password).
sprint_goal: Establish core calculator functionality and the complete user authentication lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: The test successfully registers a new, unique user. The test asserts that registration fails when using an existing email. The test runs successfully in the CI pipeline.
definition_of_done: Test code reviewed and merged; Test passes in CI.
deployment_notes: Validates the completed registration feature.
business_value: Ensures the registration process is reliable and bug-free.

title: BE: Implement API Endpoints for Calculation History (CRUD)
description: Create the NestJS module, controller, service, and DTOs for managing calculation history. Implement GET (list) and POST (create) endpoints, ensuring user ownership.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: A `POST /api/v1/history` request saves a new history item for the authenticated user. A `GET /api/v1/history` request returns only the history items for the authenticated user. Endpoints are protected by the JWT AuthGuard.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing with >85% coverage; API documentation generated.
deployment_notes: Required by the frontend to implement history persistence.
business_value: Enables the persistence of user calculation history.

title: FE: Implement History Panel Component and API Integration
description: Create the `HistoryPanel.tsx` component. Use RTK Query to fetch history on login and post new history items after each calculation.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: On login, the component fetches and displays the user's history. After a calculation, the new item is added to the list and sent to the backend. The UI correctly displays loading and error states.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; E2E tests passing.
deployment_notes: Depends on the backend API.
business_value: Provides the user-facing interface for persistent history.

title: BE: Implement API Endpoints for User Variables (UPSERT)
description: Create the NestJS module, controller, and service for managing user variables. Implement a POST endpoint that performs an 'upsert' operation and a GET endpoint to list variables.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: The POST endpoint correctly creates a new variable. The POST endpoint correctly updates an existing variable's value. All endpoints enforce user ownership.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing with >85% coverage; API documented.
deployment_notes: Required for frontend implementation of variables.
business_value: Enables persistence of user-defined variables.

title: FE: Extend Expression Parser for Variable Assignment
description: Modify the client-side expression parser to recognize the 'variable = expression' syntax and validate variable names.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: The parser correctly identifies an assignment expression. It extracts the variable name and the right-hand side expression. It rejects invalid variable names with a user-friendly error.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >90% coverage.
deployment_notes: Extends the core calculation engine.
business_value: Allows users to define variables via the calculator input.

title: FE: Implement Variable Persistence Flow
description: Integrate the new parsing logic with the UI. When an assignment is detected, evaluate the expression, then call the backend API to persist the variable.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: Entering 'myVar = 5*2' evaluates to 10. An API call is made to save 'myVar' with the value 10. The local Redux state for variables is updated.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests passing.
deployment_notes: Connects the parser logic to the backend API.
business_value: Allows users to save their defined variables.

title: FE: Implement Ohm's Law Calculation Logic
description: Create a client-side utility that takes two of the four values (V, I, R, P) and returns the other two calculated. Must cover all 6 possible input combinations.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: Given V and I, it returns correct R and P. Given R and P, it returns correct V and I. All 6 combinations are correctly implemented.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing with >90% coverage.
deployment_notes: Core logic for the Ohm's Law feature.
business_value: Provides a high-utility feature for the target electronics audience.

title: FE: Develop Ohm's Law View Component
description: Create the `OhmsLawView.tsx` component with four input fields for V, I, R, and P. Implement state management and integrate the calculation logic.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: The component renders four input fields. Entering values into any two fields populates the other two. Calculated fields are visually distinct (read-only).
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; UI is responsive and accessible.
deployment_notes: UI depends on the calculation logic.
business_value: Provides the user-facing interface for the Ohm's Law feature.

title: FE: Implement Post-Login Data Fetching
description: Upon successful login, dispatch actions to fetch the user's persisted data (calculation history, variables, custom modes) from the backend APIs. Use RTK Query to manage loading, success, and error states.
sprint_goal: Implement foundational user data persistence for history and variables, and deliver the first specialized electronics mode.
acceptance_criteria: After login, API calls are made to `/history`, `/variables`, and `/custom-modes`. The Redux store is populated with the data from these API calls. The UI correctly displays the fetched data.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests passing; Redux state verified in DevTools.
deployment_notes: This task makes the login action useful to the user.
business_value: Enables the display of personalized, persisted data after authentication.

title: BE: Implement API Endpoints for Custom Modes (CRUD)
description: Create the NestJS module, controller, service, and DTOs for full CRUD operations on `custom_modes`. All endpoints must be protected and enforce user ownership.
sprint_goal: Deliver the end-to-end user-extensible functionality and complete the 555 Timer mode.
acceptance_criteria: User can create, read, update, and delete their own modes. Attempting to access another user's mode results in a 403/404 error. API is documented via OpenAPI.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests passing with >85% coverage; Security tests for authorization passing.
deployment_notes: Foundation for all custom mode features.
business_value: Enables the persistence layer for the custom mode feature.

title: FE: Develop Multi-Step Wizard Framework
description: Create a reusable React component for a multi-step wizard. It should manage the current step, navigation between steps, and the overall state of the wizard's data.
sprint_goal: Deliver the end-to-end user-extensible functionality and complete the 555 Timer mode.
acceptance_criteria: The component can render different child components for each step. 'Next' and 'Back' buttons correctly transition between steps. State is preserved when navigating between steps.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Component tests passing; Component is documented for reuse.
deployment_notes: Framework for all wizard-based features.
business_value: Provides a reusable UI pattern for guided user flows.

title: Infra: Define Secure Lambda Function in Terraform
description: Create the Terraform module for the Formula Execution Lambda, enforcing no network access, a strict IAM role, and resource limits.
sprint_goal: Deliver the end-to-end user-extensible functionality and complete the 555 Timer mode.
acceptance_criteria: `terraform apply` provisions the Lambda function. The function's configuration in AWS Console confirms it is not in a VPC. The IAM role has no permissions other than logging.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed and merged; Resources provisioned.
deployment_notes: Infrastructure for the secure sandbox.
business_value: Provides the secure, isolated environment required for executing user code.

title: BE (Lambda): Implement Secure Sandbox with `isolated-vm`
description: Develop the Lambda handler function. The handler will use `isolated-vm` to create a V8 Isolate, inject only the allow-listed functions and constants, compile and run the user's formula script with a strict timeout.
sprint_goal: Deliver the end-to-end user-extensible functionality and complete the 555 Timer mode.
acceptance_criteria: A valid formula like `sin(pi)` executes and returns the correct result. An infinite loop is terminated by the timeout. An attempt to use `Math.random()` or `require('fs')` fails with an error.
definition_of_done: Code peer-reviewed by security specialist; Unit and security tests passing with >90% coverage.
deployment_notes: Core of the secure execution feature; highest risk task.
business_value: Securely executes untrusted user code, which is the core of the custom mode feature.

title: FE: Implement 555 Astable Calculation Logic
description: Create a client-side utility/hook to perform the 555 astable calculations, handling the three scenarios: given C, given RA, or given RB.
sprint_goal: Deliver the end-to-end user-extensible functionality and complete the 555 Timer mode.
acceptance_criteria: Given F, D, and C, it returns correct RA and RB. Given F, D, and RA, it returns correct RB and C. Given F, D, and RB, it returns correct RA and C.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing for all three calculation scenarios with >90% coverage.
deployment_notes: Core logic for the 555 Timer feature.
business_value: Enables a key specialized calculation for the target audience.

title: FE: Develop 555 Astable View Component
description: Create the `TimerAstableView.tsx` component with inputs for Frequency, Duty Cycle, and the known component value, and displays for calculated results.
sprint_goal: Deliver the end-to-end user-extensible functionality and complete the 555 Timer mode.
acceptance_criteria: The UI allows selection of the known component (RA, RB, or C). Entering valid inputs triggers the calculation and populates the results. Entering an invalid duty cycle displays an inline error message.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; E2E tests passing; UI is responsive and accessible.
deployment_notes: UI depends on the calculation logic.
business_value: Provides the user-facing interface for the 555 Timer feature.

title: FE: Implement Service Worker for Offline Caching
description: Create and configure a Service Worker to cache the application shell (HTML, CSS, JS, assets) using a cache-first strategy to enable offline loading.
sprint_goal: Implement critical data resilience (offline) and legal compliance (GDPR) features.
acceptance_criteria: After the first visit, the application loads successfully when the browser is set to offline mode. The Service Worker is registered and active. A cache-busting mechanism is in place for new deployments.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Manual testing in offline mode successful; Cache-busting verified.
deployment_notes: Enables the application to work offline at all. High risk of incorrect configuration.
business_value: Provides the foundation for all offline capabilities.

title: FE: Implement IndexedDB for Offline Action Queuing
description: Create a wrapper service for IndexedDB to store pending API requests that are made while the application is offline.
sprint_goal: Implement critical data resilience (offline) and legal compliance (GDPR) features.
acceptance_criteria: An API call made while offline is intercepted. A record representing the call is successfully stored in IndexedDB. The UI updates optimistically as if the call succeeded.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; Browser storage verified.
deployment_notes: Provides the storage for offline mutations.
business_value: Ensures no data is lost when the user is offline.

title: FE: Implement Offline Sync Manager
description: Create a 'sync manager' that listens for online/offline events, reads the queue from IndexedDB, and sends the requests to the backend, handling success and retries.
sprint_goal: Implement critical data resilience (offline) and legal compliance (GDPR) features.
acceptance_criteria: The manager detects the 'online' event. It processes the queue and sends API requests. A successful sync clears the item from the queue. A failed sync keeps the item for a later retry.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Unit tests passing; E2E tests passing for sync logic.
deployment_notes: Processes the offline queue; high risk of data loss bugs.
business_value: Restores data consistency once the user reconnects.

title: Infra: Provision SQS Queue, S3 Bucket, and Lambda for Data Export
description: Using Terraform, provision an SQS queue for export jobs, a private S3 bucket to store the exported files, and a new Lambda function for the export worker.
sprint_goal: Implement critical data resilience (offline) and legal compliance (GDPR) features.
acceptance_criteria: All three resources are created via Terraform. The S3 bucket is private. The Lambda worker has correct IAM permissions.
definition_of_done: Terraform code reviewed and merged; Resources provisioned.
deployment_notes: Infrastructure for the asynchronous GDPR export workflow.
business_value: Enables the backend processing for legal compliance.

title: BE (Lambda): Implement Data Export Worker
description: Develop the Lambda worker function to fetch all user data, compile it into JSON, upload to S3, generate a pre-signed URL, and send a notification email.
sprint_goal: Implement critical data resilience (offline) and legal compliance (GDPR) features.
acceptance_criteria: The Lambda correctly aggregates all data for a user. A JSON file is created in the S3 bucket. The user receives an email with a valid, time-limited pre-signed URL. The Lambda has robust error handling.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Integration tests with AWS mocks passing.
deployment_notes: Core logic of the asynchronous export.
business_value: Fulfills the DSAR requirement of GDPR/CCPA.

title: Infra: Integrate Automated Accessibility Testing into CI Pipeline
description: Add a step to the main GitHub Actions workflow that runs an automated accessibility audit (using Axe-core) on key pages of the application.
sprint_goal: Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance across the entire application.
acceptance_criteria: The CI pipeline includes an accessibility testing job. A PR with a component that has a clear accessibility violation fails the build at this step.
definition_of_done: CI pipeline configuration reviewed and merged; A test PR is created to verify the failure condition.
deployment_notes: Foundational for ensuring ongoing accessibility compliance.
business_value: Automates the detection of accessibility regressions.

title: FE: Audit and Remediate Core UI for Accessibility
description: Perform a comprehensive audit of all core UI components against WCAG 2.1 AA. Remediate issues related to keyboard navigation, focus management, ARIA attributes, and semantic HTML.
sprint_goal: Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance across the entire application.
acceptance_criteria: All interactive elements are reachable and operable via keyboard. Modals correctly trap focus. Dynamic content updates are announced by screen readers. All controls have accessible names.
definition_of_done: Code reviewed; Manual testing with screen readers complete; All automated a11y tests passing.
deployment_notes: A large, cross-cutting task affecting most of the UI.
business_value: Makes the application usable for people with disabilities.

title: Test: Manual E2E Testing with Screen Readers
description: Perform a manual, end-to-end test of the application's primary user flows using screen reader software (NVDA on Windows, VoiceOver on macOS).
sprint_goal: Achieve full WCAG 2.1 AA compliance across the entire application.
acceptance_criteria: A user can register, log in, perform a calculation, and save a variable using only a keyboard and screen reader. All forms and dynamic content are announced correctly.
definition_of_done: Test plan executed; All findings documented and resolved.
deployment_notes: Validates the remediation work from TASK-063-02.
business_value: Confirms that the application is truly accessible to screen reader users.
